SENT.plain: The NLR (NACHT-LRR) family of proteins have been implicated in the regulation of immune responses and cell death pathways
Some NLR family members can form multiprotein complexes, called inflammasomes, involved in the activation of pro-inflammatory caspases

Mutations in the NALP3/CIAS1/cryopyrin gene, a member of the NLR family, are linked to three auto-inflammatory disorders: Muckle-Wells syndrome, familial cold auto-inflammatory syndrome and neonatal-onset multisystem inflammatory disease
NALP3 along with the adaptor molecule ASC activates caspase-1 in response to a wide variety of stimuli
Here we review recent findings on the biology of NALP3 suggesting that it has functions beyond that of pathogen recognition
